Description: Mould-made pottery rectangular multi-nozzled lamp in the form of a temple of Isis. The building has four columns; in the rectangular doorway is a bust of Isis with the features defaced. There is a gabled entablature with a raised circle within the pediment and a crescent as acroterion/handle. There are five wick-hole along the lower edge, and two filling-holes. Within the rectangular raised base is an impressed leaf pattern. Brown, micaceous clay, worn brown to black slip overall. Plaster mould. The underside is damaged.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1975)
